results.name: If n is a multiple of 3 then a(n) = n/3, otherwise a(n) = n'+n'', where n' (resp. n'') is obtained by sorting the bits of the binary expansion of n into increasing (resp. decreasing) order.
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: if n mod (b+1) = 0 then return(n/(b+1)); fi;
program: return int(''.join(sorted(bin(n)[2:])),2) + int(''.join(sorted(bin(n)[2:],reverse=True)),2) if n % 3 else n//3 # _Chai Wah Wu_, Apr 16 2016
